message.content:
To find the average number of cereal bits per design, we divide the total number of cereal bits used (63) by the number of designs created (9):

Average number of cereal bits per design = Total number of cereal bits / Number of designs
Average number of cereal bits per design = 63 cereal bits / 9 designs
Average number of cereal bits per design ≈ 7 cereal bits

It's not clear from the given information whether Emily used an equal number of cereal bits in each design. We would need to know the exact number of cereal bits used in each design to determine this. If she did use an equal number, then all designs should have approximately 7 cereal bits each. However, if some designs had more or fewer cereal bits than others, then the average will still be 7, but some designs may have had more or less than that.
